SCIGRIP, INC. f/k/a IPS Structural Adhesives Holdings, Inc., and IPS Intermediate Holdings Corporation
v.
Samuel B. OSAE and Scott Bader, Inc. No. 139A18 Supreme Court of North Carolina. January 30, 2019 K. Edward Greene, Attorney at Law, Benjamin Thompson, Attorney at Law, Tobias S. Hampson, Attorney at Law, J. Blakely Kiefer, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for SciGrip, Inc., et al. George B. Mast, Attorney at Law, Charles D. Mast, Attorney at Law, Lily VP. Tuttle, Attorney at Law, Smithfield, for Osae, Samuel B. Philip Starch, Attorney at Law, Brodle D. Erwin, Attorney at Law, for Scott Bader Inc.

SPECIAL ORDER

*705Plaintiffs' 23 January 2019 Motion to Protect Against Disclosure of Confidential or Trade Secret Information at Oral Argument is ALLOWED only as to plaintiffs' request that the Court prohibit the parties from revealing any alleged confidential or trade secret information during oral argument. To the extent the parties need to do so, they may utilize the key referenced in plaintiffs' motion.

In all other respects, plaintiffs' motion is DENIED.

By order of the Court in Conference, this the 30th day of January, 2019.
